intro: Empogona aequatoria, commonly known as the African sour fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically sour and have a high acidity level. Empogona aequatoria is often found in woodland and scrub habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
